p: The outbreaks of SARS, MERS, and COVID-19 represent ideal cases for analyzing how the OH approach has been used concerning those zoonotic diseases. Reviewing the experiences and lessons learned from the epidemics allows envisaging the future of public health and OH. Through a systematic literature review, this work contributes to the further development of the OH approach moving from surveillance to the prevention of public health emergencies. The study aims to understand the evolution of the OH approach in relation to SARS, MERS, and COVID-19, and to identify the key OH actions taken for prevention, response, and control of those.
